meanings.definition: A type of protein found in plants that can agglutinate red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The phytohemagglutinins in the plant caused the red blood cells to clump together.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the effects of phytohemagglutinins on blood cells.
meanings.sent3: The phytohemagglutinins in the salad decided to have a party and invited all the red blood cells.
meanings.sent4: The phytohemagglutinins acted like magnets, pulling the red blood cells closer together.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a model to demonstrate how phytohemagglutinins bind red blood cells.

meanings.definition: Proteins in plants that can cause clumping of red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: Avoiding foods high in phytohemagglutinins can help prevent blood cell clumping.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the potential risks associated with consuming phytohemagglutinins.
meanings.sent3: The phytohemagglutinins in the smoothie decided to stick together and form a dance group.
meanings.sent4: The phytohemagglutinins were like puzzle pieces fitting perfectly to clump the red blood cells.
meanings.sent5: The textbook illustrated how phytohemagglutinins interact with red blood cells.

meanings.definition: Plant proteins that can agglutinate red blood cells.
meanings.sent1: The salad contained phytohemagglutinins that affected the blood cells' behavior.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are investigating the role of phytohemagglutinins in plant defense mechanisms.
meanings.sent3: The phytohemagglutinins in the garden were known for their ability to bring red blood cells together for a chat.
meanings.sent4: The phytohemagglutinins functioned like glue, sticking the red blood cells in place.
meanings.sent5: The students conducted an experiment to observe how phytohemagglutinins interact with red blood cells.
